paragraphs.content: A Psalm and Song at the dedication of the house of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Psalm and Song at the dedication of the house of David.

paragraphs.content: I will extol thee, O LORD; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will extol thee, O Lord; for thou hast lifted me up, and hast not made my foes to rejoice over me.

paragraphs.content: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

paragraphs.content: Sing unto the LORD, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing unto the Lord, O ye saints of his, and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

paragraphs.content: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

paragraphs.content: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be moved.

paragraphs.content: LORD, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, by thy favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong: thou didst hide thy face, and I was troubled.

paragraphs.content: I cried to thee, O LORD; and unto the LORD I made supplication.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I cried to thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication.

paragraphs.content: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit? Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth?

paragraphs.content: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me: LORD, be thou my helper.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear, O Lord, and have mercy upon me: Lord, be thou my helper.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness;

paragraphs.content: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
